Package com.lopl.melody.utils.database

Class DataBase

java.lang.Object
com.lopl.melody.utils.database.DataBase
public class DataBase
extends java.lang.Object
This class is the accessor to the database. The file and all the tables are managed here. Do not use this class to make changes to any table. Change this class only if you want to make changes to the general behaviour of the database. If you want to execute sql statements use the SQL class.

  • Constructor Details

    • DataBase

      public DataBase()

  • Method Details

    • createDatabaseFile

      private static void createDatabaseFile()
      This will check if the database file exists. If not a new one is created.

    • setup

      private static void setup()
      This will link the database file with this code and create a HikariDataSource object. This object is used to create a connection to the database. This Connection can than be used with the getConnection() method to execute SQL Statements.

    • createTables

      public static void createTables()
      This will create and update all tables if needed. Every table should have its own function, that is called here.

    • createSettingsTable

      private static void createSettingsTable​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      This will create the settings table if necessary. Then it will also check if all columns are present. If columns are missing these are added. TODO: check for double columns, check for obsolete columns FutureTODO: if a rename of a column is necessary, a easy to add implementation should be built.
      Parameters:
      statement - an empty Statement that can be used
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when there is any sql error

    • createMixerTable

      private static void createMixerTable​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      This will create the mixer table if necessary.
      Parameters:
      statement - an empty Statement that can be used
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when there is any sql error

    • dropTables

      @Deprecated private static void dropTables()
      Deprecated.

    • getConnection

      public static java.sql.Connection getConnection() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Use this method to get a connection to the database not something else! This method will make sure, there is only on connection. Multiple connections are not allowed.
      Returns:
      a ready to use Connection
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when there is any sql error
